page.title: 18OTTERY IN PAST TIMES
page.content: Some children interviewed elderly people to learn about the changes that have taken place in the last 50 to 60 years. Previously there were three schools, an Infant school in Jesu Street which is now the Play school, a Boys school in Yonder Street and the Girls school in Sandhill Street. Children started school at 3 or 4 years of age,moved to the Boys or Girls school at 7 and left there at 13 or 14. A few children, if they passed an examination or if their parents paid for them, went to the Kings School which was at the Priory before it moved to its present site in 1928. All the teachers were very stict and often punished the children with the cane or slipper. Today it is very rare for a child to be caned or smacked.
